sn18.11:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī.
sn18.11:4.3: Then Venerable Rāhula went up to the Buddha,
sn18.11:4.4: bowed, and sat down to one side.
sn18.11:4.6: “What do you think, Rāhula? Is form permanent or impermanent?”
sn18.11:4.8: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn18.11:4.10: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn18.11:4.11: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn18.11:4.17: Is the mind permanent or impermanent?”
sn18.11:4.19: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn18.11:4.21: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn18.11:4.22: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn18.11:4.24: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with the eye,
sn18.11:4.32: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn18.11:4.33: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
sn18.11:4.34: (The ten discourses of this series should be treated in the same way.)
